greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Rule 30 binary tree permutation: a(1) = 1, a(2n) = A269160(a(n)), a(2n+1) = A269164(1+a(n)).
comment: This sequence can be represented as a binary tree. Each left hand child is produced as A269160(n), and each right hand child as A269164(1+n), when the parent node contains n:

Each maximal leftward branch (e.g. 1, 7, 25, ... (= A110240) or 9, 63, 193, ... or 2, 14, 50, ...) gives a trajectory of Rule 30 cellular automaton starting from a particular "seed configuration" which are given in A269164.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1023
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
mathematica: nmax = (* sequence length *) 100; terms (* from A269164 *) = 2000; Clear[a, f]; A269160[n_] := BitXor[n, BitOr[2 n, 4 n]]; f[max_] := f[max] = (s = Sort[Table[A269160[n], {n, 0, max}]]; Complement[Range[Last[s]], s][[1 ;; terms]]); f[terms]; f[max = 2 terms]; While[f[max] != f[max/2], max = 2 max]; A269164[n_Integer] := If[n > Length[f[max]], 0, f[max][[n]]]; a[1] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = If[EvenQ[n], A269160[a[n/2]], A269164[1 + a[(n - 1)/2]]]; A269168 = Table[a[n], {n, 1, nmax}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 23 2016 *)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 21 2016
